TopicTitle: [0.21][Parts Pack]Deep Space Mission Pack - Now open source!

Articles.Content: This is really good for my grand tour missions around Jool/Solar System!

I got two suggestions...

1.Spherical batteries/fueltanks

2.Cargo bay for landers being hidden during interplanetary mission(maybe for future as heatshield when aerobraking around gas giants for stable orbit)
Can you post the launcher vehicle?

Overview:

what are the orange panels on the top end of the ship from?

EDIT: feel free to shout at me if they're from a more recent version of the DSM pack :l

Edited October 6, 2012 by haydn1997

what are the orange panels on the top end of the ship from?

Those are from here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/6280-0-17-ExPI-Space-Stations-0-4-Interplanetary-Probes-0-1-2

What are the nuclear reactors for? I don't see a matching engine.

Unless it's supposed to be some endless fuel tank for ion engines?

It's very heavy and cannot support an ion engine at full thrust, but it's good if you don't mind having a horrible TWR because you can use the ion engine at night too.

You should consider using one or two batteries instead though, they're a lot lighter than a single reactor.
The ion engines still lag as hell after the new update :(

The ion engines still lag as hell after the new update :(

Yep, sadly that problem is plugin related, but I'm sure Kreuzung is already working on it.

>cheez, kockaspiton

It's fixed (at least my super laggy ship works fine now), see this thread.

>cheez, kockaspiton

It's fixed (at least my super laggy ship works fine now), see this thread.

I'm using the latest version (i think) of your electricity plugin (1.4.2) and the problem is still present. I don't get it...

just downloaded the Deep Space Mission Pack and its related packs but i can not get the Ion engines to work. im unable to click on them durring the construction phase to place them. what do i need to do to get it to work?

I'm using the latest version (i think) of your electricity plugin (1.4.2) and the problem is still present. I don't get it...

Same here. Maybe I've overdone it a bit with 8 ion engines

As soon as I turn them on I get less than a frame/second
Sorry, that was a bit unclear, the fix hasn't been released yet.

When we will get the Fix? Do you know a date?

Oh and Great work i have to say =)
This is a great Part pack. I like everything about it. The only proplem i have is with the DSM Decoupler. It seems whenever i use it, there is a 80% chance it just explodes and cripples my ship.
I having problems building anything even remotely close to pics in OP without it breaking under it's own weight.
Thanks for the update. One of the greatests mods ever, respect man.
Updated the first post again after the forum died . Could a mod please remove/disable the poll again?
Does the centrifuge spin now?

Does the centrifuge spin now?

Sure, as long as you keep pressing Q or E . Nope, they don't work yet, to be honest I'm not really an expert in animation and that part of KSP moding isn't very well documented either. I could make it work by the usal try and error approach but I don't really feel up to the task right now. Maybe when 0.20 comes out and I'll be inspired about the game again .

That's okay - I always thought of the centrifuge part as being a housing for an internal living wheel. Sort of like how it was on the Discovery in 2001 Space Odyssey - the spin-hab wasn't visible as such from the outside.

(Kubrick only got two things wrong with that concept - 1) The hab needed to be MUCH bigger to provide anything close to Earth normal "gravity" without inducing Coriolis motion sickness in the crew. And 2) There needed to be TWO spin-habs, with the 2nd one counter-rotating to cancel out the torque and keep the Discovery herself from spinning. Although I COULD see the use of a complicated set of weights and counter-spinning "inner ring" in-line with the spin-hab ring that would work as well. But if you're going to go to that much trouble, you may as well have the 2nd spin-hab anyway.)

Isnt this the ship from Mission To Mars? (Love That Film) I only wish the mods centrifuge part serve a purpose ,would be cool if you decoupled just before landing then moved over slightly and landed next to it and you could still have the ERV like of the Film (if this is of the film) and the centrifuge could act as a place to store kerbals or even space for a rover?

But these things are a bit too much of an asking since your not inspired by the game at the moment. But it would be cool

Love the mod using it since 0.17 .(when i got the game)

Edited April 19, 2013 by samcar304

I was planning a centrifuge piece when I said to myself "for each and every action there is an equal and opposite reaction". So a centrifuge = spinning.. spinning everywhere. Whats a good centrifuge design? Anyone got any pics (bitmap or otherwise) I can use as reference material?

Just have two centrifuges spinning in different directions.

Or an over-complicated S.A.S. + A.S.A.S. piece that counter-acts the rotative forces by it's own, without messing with any RCS.
